content:
I'd be happy to help you discover some hidden gems on Netflix.

Here are some highly-acclaimed and popular documentaries on Netflix that you might have missed:

1. **"Free Solo" (2018)**: A breathtaking documentary that follows Alex Honnold's attempt to climb El Capitan in Yosemite National Park without any ropes.
2. **"Jiro Dreams of Sushi" (2011)**: A mouth-watering documentary that explores the life and craft of Jiro Ono, a legendary sushi chef in Tokyo.
3. **"The Imposter" (2012)**: A true-crime documentary that tells the story of a young Frenchman who impersonated a missing Texas boy.
4. **"The Inventor: Out for Blood in Silicon Valley" (2019)**: A documentary about the rise and fall of Theranos, a biotech company that claimed to have revolutionized blood testing.
5. **"Fyre: The Greatest Party That Never Happened" (2019)**: A wild documentary about the failed Fyre Festival, a luxury music festival that turned into a disaster.
6. **"The Staircase" (2004)**: A true-crime documentary series that follows the trial of Michael Peterson, who was accused of murdering his wife in their home.
7. **"Abducted in Plain Sight" (2017)**: A documentary about the Broberg family, whose daughter was kidnapped multiple times by a close family friend.
8. **"The Game Changers" (2018)**: A documentary that explores the benefits of a plant-based diet and its impact on athletic performance.
9. **"The September Issue" (2009)**: A behind-the-scenes look at the creation of the September issue of Vogue magazine, featuring Anna Wintour.
10. **"The Square" (2013)**: A documentary about the Egyptian Revolution of 2011 and its aftermath.

These documentaries have received critical acclaim and are highly rated on Netflix. I hope you find something that piques your interest!

Do you have a specific topic or genre in mind that you're interested in exploring? I can give you more tailored recommendations if you'd like!
